nodes.text: These bodies have been here a long time, there's nothing much left to them but bones. It sort of looks like someone passed out after too much drinking... and the smaller skeleton looks like it could have been a cat.
So how did they wind up trapped in this sealed room with some name scrawled in blood and wine across the wall?
Huh... it got really cold here all of a sudden... like I was walking on a grave.
Which, I guess, is just what I am doing here right now.
The bones look so sad trapped and forgotten here in this dirty little room.
There's only a faint glimmer of magic left behind by the spirits who died here.
But there seems to be some magic over by the pile of stuff in the corner.

I sense... pain... betrayal... the horror of being trapped alive... There's a ghostly presence nearby... two of them... just waiting in the shadows between the world of the living and the world of the dead...
Ugh. Nasty, scary impressions of murder. This was not an accident, but I already suspected as much.
Ah, these are just the thing to add to my collection!
(Which is exactly the sort of statement a person going to Villain University would say.)
Me? I've already collected the whole set.
Okay, so I don't really collect bones...

Aeolus would have a fit if I put them in our room...
But then again, he'd probably never notice them in all the clutter.
But I can take a closer look at them to see what happened to this poor guy.
I wonder if the ghosts are still here...
Yikes!
Why dost thou disturb our bones?
You were once a hero of this castle. You deserve better than to have your soul bound here at the site of your murder for all eternity. You deserve to be buried with honor.
There is a tomb set aside for you and your cat. I thought I could move your bones to where they belong.
There is great kindness in your gesture of respect. Take these dregs of my existence away and release us from this cruel tomb of our demise.
<meow>
In a section of the castle, there is a tomb with your name on it. It was clearly set up to honor you as a hero.
I thought that it would be right and fitting that your bones should be laid to rest in the manner that you deserve.
Thou speaketh humbly and most wise. Our remains have mouldered here too long - my soul bound only by my thirst for vengeance.
These cruel bleak walls remind me only of my cruel betrayal and murder. Perhaps away from this accursed prison, my soul shall be free.
I give thee leave to set us to our rest.
<meow>
Yeah, right, you're welcome.

I thought I'd add your skulls to my collection of "People who don't know when to let it go." After all, if you are going to hang out for eternity as a ghost, you might as well do it with other "Vengeance Shall Be Mine!" sorts.
<Hssss!>
Okay, I'm just kidding!
Face it - you're dead. Your murderer must also be long dead. There's no way you will ever be avenged.
It's time for you to forgive and forget - or at least give up this wasted afterlife.
I'm going to put your bones to rest in the tomb where they belong. If you are going to haunt this castle, you might as well haunt it in a place of honor.
Thou speakest words of wisdom and great weight. Remove these mouldering dregs of murder most foul and ease us to our peace.
<meow>
I'll just put these in my backpack for now.
They're heavy! They also smell like dank decay. I don't want to carry these around any longer than I have to.
There's no real reason to disturb these bones unless I have a place to put them.
So I guess I'll just leave them alone for now.
Um... uh... I was just trying to see what happened to you... why you died and all that sort of thing...
It was murder most foul and loathsome! Betrayed, poisoned, and imprisoned in this cruel trap by one I once deemed boon companion.
He murdered us, even as he plotted to defile the Knights Luminar and unleash the minions of Darkness!
Wooooooooaaaaaaahhhh!
Rrraaarrrrhhh!
Ghost dust... I guess this ghost must be dusty enough...
Yikes! It's burning cold!
One... two... three... That better do it because it feels like my hand has frozen off.
I really wish I could speak Ghost. I'm sure you are trying to tell me something.
